meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Estonia.
meanings.sent1: In Estonia, you can buy many things with just one kors.
meanings.sent2: The price of the item was 5 kors.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with a kors instead of a euro!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand kors.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kors sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in Turkey.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for two kors of flour.
meanings.sent2: The scale showed the meat weighed 3 kors.
meanings.sent3: I tried to lift the heavy bag of potatoes, but it felt like a ton of kors!
meanings.sent4: His burden was as heavy as a kors on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The kors on the scale tipped in favor of the customer.

meanings.sent1: The beach was covered in colorful kors.
meanings.sent2: The fish loved to hide among the kors in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: I pretended to have a seaweed mustache using the kors.
meanings.sent4: The kors swayed gently with the current, like a dance in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The salty air was filled with the scent of fresh kors.

meanings.sent1: Mr. and Mrs. Kors arrived at the party.
meanings.sent2: The Kors family reunion was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent3: I thought Kors was a famous fashion designer, but it turns out it's just a surname!
meanings.sent4: The name Kors echoed through the halls of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: Kors was written in elegant script on the family crest.
